display_asset.caption: Mary T. Barra, General Motors’ C.E.O., in 2015.

summaries.body: A review of nearly 22,000 companies found that having women in the highest corporate offices correlated with increased profitability.

display_asset.caption: A street in Bethnal Green, East London, home to a conservative Muslim community. Three teenage girls from a school in the area were drawn to the Islamic State.
display_asset.credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times

summaries.body: A program encouraging British citizens to identify potential radicals has raised questions about racial and religious profiling.

display_asset.caption: A bee gathers nectar from lavender flowers.

summaries.body: The deformed wing virus is destroying bee populations worldwide, and it is spreading because of the human transport of bees, a new study reports.

display_asset.caption: Jackson Martínez, left, departed the Spanish club Atlético Madrid for Guangzhou Evergrande in the Chinese Super League for more than $45 million last week.

summaries.body: Whatever the slowdown in China’s economy, there is enough money left around for its soccer clubs to ​throw fortunes at the feet of foreign players​.

posts.footer: ProPublica and The Daily News (New York)

summaries.body: A little-known legal tool the police in New York use to throw residents out of their homes is under scrutiny after a recent investigation.

display_asset.caption: Two commuter trains collided head-on near Bad Aibling, southeast of Munich, on Tuesday.
display_asset.credit: Peter Kneffel/DPA, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Two commuter trains crashed head-on in Germany's southeastern state of Bavaria, leaving nine dead and dozens injured.
South Korean organizers successfully held the first test events for the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang.

display_asset.caption: Rioters set fires in the Mong Kok district of Hong Kong on Tuesday. More than 40 police officers and journalists were injured in the riot on the first day of Chinese New Year celebrations.

summaries.body: Nearly 50 police officers were reported injured and 24 protesters were arrested amid Lunar New Year festivities in Hong Kong after officers tried to shut down food vendors.
New research suggests that children living with half- or step-siblings before kindergarten are more aggressive more often, on average, than other children.

display_asset.credit: Paul J. Richards/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Chipotle closed its restaurants for four hours to tell workers about food safety upgrades after reports of foodborne illnesses. "People will come back," Chipotle's founder said.

display_asset.caption: The storm created broken glass throughout the Anthem of the Seas cruise ship.
display_asset.credit: Noah Fecks for The New York Times

summaries.body: "I began contemplating whether or not I should start composing goodbye messages," writes a passenger on a cruise cut short after sailing through a strong storm.

display_asset.caption: Waris Ahluwalia in 2013.
display_asset.credit: Casey Kelbaugh for The New York Times

summaries.body: The American actor Waris Ahluwalia, a Sikh, is stuck in an airport in Mexico after he was barred from a flight because he refused to remove his turban for a security check.

display_asset.caption: The Buffalo Bills running back LeSean McCoy in 2015.

summaries.body: Bills running back LeSean McCoy is said to be under investigation for assaulting off-duty officers during a dispute he was reportedly involved in at a Philadelphia club.

display_asset.caption: A large storm system was working its way north off shore near the Mid-Atlantic United States.

summaries.body: New England on Monday confronted one of the heaviest snowfalls of the season, with forecasts predicting as much as 18 inches in parts of Massachusetts.

display_asset.caption: Larycia Hawkins spoke at a news conference last month about termination proceedings against her by Wheaton College, an evangelical Christian institution in Illinois.

summaries.body: Wheaton College, an evangelical institution, and an associate professor who donned a hijab in "religious solidarity with Muslims” are to part ways, they announced.

display_asset.caption: Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive of Facebook, speaking in New Delhi in 2014. He personally lobbied for the company’s Free Basics program.

summaries.body: Facebook experienced a setback in India, where regulators banned free mobile data programs, such as its Free Basics program, that favor some Internet services over others.
Twenty-three migrants have drowned after a boat sank off the coast of Turkey, the Turkish Coast Guard said, and a search is underway for the remaining passengers.
In an interview, the late photographer Dennis Stock recalls how he shot his ​classic photo essay of James Dean​, who was born 85 years ago today.
Seltzer contains an acid that erodes your tooth enamel.

asset.embed_html: <iframe class="embedly-embed" src="//cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FMh5LY4Mz15o%3Ffeature%3Doembed&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DMh5LY4Mz15o&image=https%3A%2F%2Fi.ytimg.com%2Fvi%2FMh5LY4Mz15o%2Fhqdefault.jpg&key=170aca4a25074a88942b11f27e7ca43f&type=text%2Fhtml&schema=youtube" width="854" height="480" scrolling="no" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

summaries.body: This video history of Japan takes viewers from humans’ first presence on the archipelago all the way to 1991.

display_asset.caption: Tidjane Thiam

summaries.body: The chief executive of Credit Suisse has asked the company’s board to ​reduce his bonus​ after the bank reported a multibillion-dollar quarterly loss.

display_asset.caption: Misael Lopez and his pit bull Cookie visited a new pet food pantry in the Bronx last month. The pantry gave away 2,000 pounds of pet food in one month.

summaries.body: Pet food pantries have sprung up across the country, including in New York City, to help people who view their pets as family, and spend their last dollars on a can of Purina.
A newly obtained report shows that a task force commissioned by the oil industry in 1982 acknowledged the fateful impact that humans could have on the climate.

display_asset.caption: Julianna Margulies in "The Good Wife."

summaries.body: CBS used a Super Bowl commercial to announce that the current season of "The Good Wife" would be its last. It was "the biggest 'Good Wife' surprise yet," the ad said.

display_asset.caption: Footage of the eruption of the volcano on Mount Sakurajima, on the southern Japanese island Kyushu. It is 30 miles from a nuclear plant.

sectionFrontImages.caption: Sakurajima volcano erupted in southern Japan on Friday.

display_asset.title: Sakurajima Volcano Erupts

summaries.body: Here is dramatic footage of an ​erupting volcano on Mount Sakurajima, located 30 miles from a nuclear plant in southern Japan.

display_asset.caption: Pat Haden took over as head of U.S.C.’s athletic department in 2010.

summaries.body: Pat Haden, who won two national titles as a quarterback at U.S.C. and then became its athletic director after it was hit with N.C.A.A. sanctions, will step down in June.

display_asset.caption: An olm, a foot-long cave-dwelling amphibian, in the Postojna Cave in Slovenia.

summaries.body: Biologists in Slovenia are awaiting a rare brood of olms, cave-dwelling salamanders once thought of as tiny dragons that can live to 100 and go 10 years without food.

display_asset.caption: From left, Rachel McAdams, Mark Ruffalo, Brian d’Arcy James, Michael Keaton and John Slattery in a scene from “Spotlight.”
display_asset.credit: Kerry Hayes/Open Road Films, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A Vatican commission investigating sexual abuse by priests got a private screening of the movie "Spotlight," which depicts The Boston Globe's reporting of those crimes.

Employees of a San Diego restaurant arrived at work Thursday to find a sea lion pup curled up in a booth. Cute, yes, but also an example of a species being found in unexpected places because of a changing environment.

display_asset.caption: Julian Assange gave a speech from a balcony at the Ecuadorian Embassy in London in 2012.

summaries.body: The New York Times looks back at the Julian Assange story, after a U.N. report said Sweden and Britain should restore his freedom of movement and compensate him.
